meanings.definition: An action such as a prolonged speech that obstructs progress in a legislative assembly.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the filibusters by some members delayed the decision.
meanings.sent2: The filibusters in the parliament caused the session to run late.
meanings.sent3: The filibusters' speeches were so long that even the clock seemed tired.
meanings.sent4: The filibusters' words acted like roadblocks on the path of progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of filibusters talking endlessly painted a vivid picture of delay.

meanings.definition: A person engaging in such obstructionist tactics.
meanings.sent1: The filibusters were determined to stall the vote with their speeches.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the most skilled filibusters in the senate.
meanings.sent3: The filibusters' antics amused the audience, despite the serious topic.
meanings.sent4: He was a master of using words as filibusters to halt any decision.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the filibusters made progress seem like a distant dream.
